long_desc.thetext:
Created attachment 220832 CDT_Updating_Folding
An internal error has occurred. org.eclipse.cdt.internal.ui.editor.CEditor.getInputCElement()Lorg/eclipse/cdt/core/model/ICElement;
I looked for a solution and changing the following files on the plugins folder: org.eclipse.cdt.mylyn.ui_3.8.1.v20120725-0100.jar with org.eclipse.cdt.mylyn.ui_3.8.0.v20120612-0600.jar
it solved the problem but then the focus active task for file Outline it shows empty. Maybe a total roleback can solve this second problem but didn't try it yet.
Eclipse info:
Mylyn 3.8.1 TaskTop 2.4.1 Eclipse Plataform 4.2 Eclipse CDT 8.1.0
Does the error log entry have a stack trace?

(In reply to comment #1) > Does the error log entry have a stack trace?
The exception stack trace is attached https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/attachment.cgi?id=220832.

I am having the exact same problem. Same error trace, so far as I can tell.
I had been using mylyn for a couple of months before the problem started and am using Juno 20130225-0426. The mylyn copyright is 2013 so it appears that everything is up to date.
I downloaded a fresh copy of Juno CDT, installed it and it worked fine. When I installed mylyn the problem immediately returned. I uninstalled mylyn and the problem went away. Earlier, I had created a new workspace and the problem did not occur but returned when I switched back to the previous workspace. I may not have had mylyn activated at the time, tho.
Very curious that mylyn would have any interaction with folding.
mylyn 3.8.3 cdt 8.1.2
Sam, can you take a look?
I will try to look into this tomorrow or Friday.

This happens when "Automatically Fold Uninteresting Elements" is enabled. The reason is that the ICElement interface is no longer present in CDT 8.1.2 (not sure in which version it was removed). The fix is trivial: https://git.eclipse.org/r/#/c/12367/
I have verified that "Automatically Fold Uninteresting Elements" works correctly with this fix.
*** Bug 407006 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I would like to go back to using Mylyn until 3.9 is released with the fix. (BTW, nice work guys.)
If I disable "Automatically Fold Uninteresting Elements" will it prevent the error messages from being shown? If so, how to do that?
I couldn't find it under Window/Preferences/Mylyn. (I tried unchecking 'Auto expand tree views when focused' and 'Manage open editors to match task context')
A web search for that phrase only shows it in the context of Java Eclipse and I'm using CDT.
Thanks again.
It is controlled by a toggle button in the Eclipse toolbar with the same icon as the focus button used in views. I think it should prevent the error from happening.

Yes, it does. Thank you again.
(I had my toolbar hidden and that is why I couldn't find it. It's kind of strange that there is no option to do this under Windows/Preferences/Mylyn but that is a discussion for another day.)

Thanks for confirming.
I think it's meant to be regularly toggled on and off (if it's used at all), just like focusing in the task list, outline, and other views, which aren't controlled on the preferences page (other than a global option to auto focus on activation, which probably ought to affect folding too if it doesn't).
Additionally, I get the same error if I check "Remove file from context when editor is closed" in the Mylyn/Context prefs and then activate a different task.

It turns out that the problem is slightly different than I thought and will require using reflection to fix. Something very strange happened when I installed CDT into Juno that caused the ICElement interface not to show up, but it is in fact still there.
The actual problem is that the signature of CEditor.getInputCElement() has changed, breaking binary compatibility. It now returns an IWorkingCopy rather than an ICElement (which is still a superinterface of IWorkingCopy). In order for this to work on Juno, we'll have to use reflection to call this method.
As Michael points out, this will affect everywhere that we call this method, so disabling "Automatically Fold Uninteresting Elements" will not completely prevent the error.
The change was merged. Thanks very much, Sam!
